Mr. William G. Harley
600 North Park
Madison 6, Wisconsin
Dear Bill:
Your very kind note of December 29 and your Christmas card added to the
cheer of the season.
I am remiss in not having written you a note long ago expressing my great
admiration for the work you have done during the past two years as President
of the National Association of Educational Broadcasters, especially since,
as you say, I was responsible in part for getting you in that job. Your
work prior to becoming president and my genuine belief in your strengh
and intelligence as an educational broadcaster convinced me that you were
the best man in the organization for the job. I have never had any reason
to question my initial opinion.
I know you leave the job with a great sense of relief, some misgiving, and
some doubts; however, in my opinion, you have provided truly outstanding
leadership and should have a great sense of satisfaction and accomplishment.
It was a real pleasure working with you on the Board.
My warmest and kindest regards.
GA: sb
P. S. Please give Mac my congratulations at having you back on the staff
full time.
